meanings.definition: To mark or color with red
meanings.sent1: She enjoys rubricating her drawings with bright red markers.
meanings.sent2: The artist was rubricating the painting with a vibrant shade of red.
meanings.sent3: While rubricating her artwork, she accidentally got red marker on her hands.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun was rubricating the sky with a deep shade of red.
meanings.sent5: The child's face lit up as she saw her mother rubricating the birthday card with a red heart.

meanings.definition: To add rubrics or headings to a text
meanings.sent1: The teacher spent hours rubricating the students' essays with detailed feedback.
meanings.sent2: Rubricating the document will help organize the information more effectively.
meanings.sent3: He found himself rubricating the grocery list with categories like 'dairy' and 'produce'.
meanings.sent4: The editor was rubricating the manuscript with clear section headings.
meanings.sent5: She was rubricating the report with bold headings to make it easier to read.
